channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox is about to unload $9 billion of coins onto the market. Here's what it means
item.description: Bitcoin investors are spooked by anticipation of an imminent Mt. Gox payout to victims of a 2014 hack on the exchange that led to its collapse.

item.title: Crypto firm Circle gets approval to issue stablecoin in EU under bloc’s strict rules
item.description: Crypto firm Circle said it's been granted an e-money license from France, bringing it into compliance with stablecoin rules under European Union crypto laws.

item.title: After France's right-wing surge, parties seen scrambling to block a National Rally win
item.description: Left-wing and centrist parties in France are scrambling to block the far-right National Rally from winning the ongoing parliamentary snap election.

item.title: Meta accused of breaching EU antitrust rules over ad-supported subscription service
item.description: Meta was on Monday accused by EU regulators of failing to comply with the bloc's landmark antitrust rules over its ad-supported social networking service.

item.title: French stocks jump as far right takes election lead but seen falling short of majority
item.description: La Banque Postale Asset Management's Sebastian Paris Horvitz said the results indicate a hung parliament is most likely — the "least bad" option for markets.

item.title: Google invests in BlackRock-backed Taiwanese solar developer to boost energy capacity amid AI boom
item.description: Google announced it is partnering with BlackRock to develop a 1 gigawatt pipeline of new solar capacity in Taiwan.

item.title: Supreme Court keeps Trump election case alive, but rules he has some immunity for official acts
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is charged with illegally conspiring to overturn his loss to President Joe Biden in the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Here are the 10 most livable cities in the world—Europe dominates the list
item.description: Vienna, Copenhagen and Zurich topped the list for the most livable cities in the world, according to EIU's 2024 Global Liveability Index.

item.title: Gen Z's shopping decisions are heavily driven by TikTok and influencers, report finds
item.description: Brands are reassessing their supply chain strategies and emphasizing social commerce platforms to cater to Gen Z, especially TikTok and Instagram.

item.title: Taiwan tops Asia's best-performing stock markets so far in 2024 — Japan is No. 2
item.description: Global markets this year have been largely driven by the themes of AI and central bank policy, and that is likely to continue, according to T. Rowe Price.

item.title: A phobia specialist shares his 3 top tips to overcome any fear from spiders to public speaking
item.description: A phobia specialist shared three top tips to recondition your brain when facing an irrational fear including changing your internal dialogues and feelings.

item.title: Millennials are ‘very ill-prepared’ to be the richest generation in history, wealth manager says
item.description: Millennials are purportedly poised to be the wealthiest generation in history, but are they ready to handle the vast inflow of money?

item.title: Boeing agrees to buy fuselage maker Spirit AeroSystems in $4.7 billion deal
item.description: Boeing is buying the supplier of fuselages as it looks for a way out of its manufacturing and safety crisis.

item.title: U.S. plans to seek guilty plea from Boeing over fatal 737 Max crashes
item.description: The U.S. is expected to seek a guilty plea and offer Boeing a deal over the fatal 737 Max crashes, victims' family members said Sunday.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Boeing 'guilty plea,' French far-right gains
item.description: U.S. prosecutors seek a guilty plea from Boeing over the 737 Max crashes. Marine Le Pen's far-right party gained in France's elections.

item.title: Americans and Japanese take far less time off — but Europeans say they're more 'vacation deprived'
item.description: Some 84% of Germans and 69% of French workers said they feel "vacation deprived" even though they take the most days off work, according to an Expedia study.

item.title: Obama, Clinton excuse Biden's debate performance to fend off Democratic meltdown: 'Bad debate nights happen'
item.description: President Biden and Donald Trump are scheduled to face off at a second and final debate on Sept. 10.

item.title: China is testing the limits of a critical U.S.-Philippines defense pact — will Washington respond?
item.description: China has stepped up its actions against the Philippines in disputed waters of the South China Sea, raising questions of American deterrence in the region.

item.title: 'Inside Out 2' tops $1 billion at the global box office, first film to do so since 'Barbie'
item.description: Before "Inside Out 2," no Disney animated feature from Pixar or its Walt Disney Animation studio had generated more than $480 million at the global box office since 2019.

item.title: Chinese smartphone maker Honor says AI's power is 'worthless' without data privacy
item.description: The transforming power of artificial intelligence is of no value unless user data is protected, says the CEO of Chinese smartphone company Honor, George Zhao.

item.title: Apple's Vision Pro starts deliveries at a higher price in China than in the U.S.
item.description: Apple's mixed-reality headset began deliveries in China on Friday with a retail price 18% higher than in the U.S.

item.title: Record summer airline travel is starting, and so are the flight delays
item.description: TSA is predicting record screened passengers for the July 4th period of travel, and if it's anything like recent years, flight delays will be an issue.

item.title: Amazon is doubling value of credits for some startups to build on AWS as Microsoft cloud gains ground
item.description: With Microsoft's artificial intelligence technology drawing in more entrepreneurs to its cloud, Amazon wants to ensure that founders keep building on AWS.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The humble onion could be holding India's economy hostage
item.description: Even a modest change in the price of the bulbous vegetable soon becomes the talking point around dinner tables for hundreds of millions of people in the country.

item.title: Financial crimes watchdog removes Turkey from money laundering 'gray list'
item.description: The FATF had previously found Turkish sectors like banking and property vulnerable to illicit financing of groups like the Islamic State and al-Qaeda.

item.title: Growth, value stocks could see boost from Russell rebalancing
item.description: This key market event could help boost growth and value stocks. Here’s why.

item.title: Biden debate flop leads Democrats to call for new nominee — but replacing him is tough to do
item.description: President Joe Biden emerged bruised from his first presidential debate with Donald Trump, raising fears about his age and ability to serve another term.

item.title: Iran votes for its new president amid economic strife, crackdowns and regional war
item.description: If there is no clear majority after Friday's vote, the top two candidates face a second round of voting on July 5.

item.title: Nike CEO John Donahoe comes under fire as stock sees worst day on record
item.description: Nike's CEO John Donahoe has helmed the sneaker giant for nearly five years, but under his watch, its stock has underperformed and its lost market share.

item.title: France's far right looks headed for victory in the first round at the polls. Here's what that means
item.description: With just days to go until France's snap parliamentary election kicks off, victory for the far right looks increasingly likely in the first phase of the two-stage runoff.
